content:
A Twitter user asks if there are any "large" Backdrop sites?
https://twitter.com/alexborsody/status/1303401717011288065

@backdropcms I'm seeing more of a serious interest in backdrop CMS especially as the EOL approaches. I am on 3 projects right now that are in 7 with no real plans/desire to update. There are also more than a few devs I know that still prefer 7. Any large sites use backdrop now?

- Alex B âš¡ (@alexborsody)
I'm not sure how to answer that. Do we have any "large" sites we can showcase? NOTE: I don't know what "large" means.

I wrote a reply, mentioning my largest site. But seem to have forgotten to setup the Twitter preview properly;-) https://twitter.com/matthiaswalti/status/1303623536083374080

@alexborsody @backdropcms This site has been my largest so far (>400 nodes, heavy use of relations and context). It was kind of a test if I should make the switch for all new projects and also larger ones. No major problems found, test completed successfully https://landwirtschaft.ag/

- Matthias Walti (@matthiaswalti)

StPaulTim said:

I'm not sure how to answer that. Do we have any "large" sites we can showcase? NOTE: I don't know what "large" means.

Depends on what you mean by large sites, I have one in development for a catholic high school that is over several thousand pages ( really haven't counted in a while), with ecommerce (not much of that - mostly info), slideshows, photogalleries, etc..
